nameEntry.part: Victorian Adoption Network for Information and Self Help

biogHist.abstract: The Victorian Adoption Network for Information and Self Help (VANISH Inc) started operating at 167 Drummond Street, Carlton on the 13th of February 1989. It is a self-help organisation which provides search, information and support services for people affected by adoption and donor conception. Until 2009, it also provided services to Forgotten Australians. In June 2009, these services were taken over by the Interim Service for Forgotten Australians, within the Centre for Excellence in Child and Family Welfare. The Interim Service was replaced in November 2009 by the Support Service for Victoria's Forgotten Australia (Open Place).

descriptiveNote.p: VANISH is a self-help organisation, which provided services to Forgotten Australians in Victoria until 2009.
VANISH is a self-help organisation for people affected by adoption.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Department of Human Services, State Government of Victoria (1995 - 2014)

descriptiveNote.p: VANISH is funded by the Victorian State Government through the Department of Human Services.
VANISH was a Linkage Partner to the Who Am I? project.
In 2009 the Interim Service for Forgotten Australians took over services that had previously been provided by VANISH.
